Hildegard Franke, freshEHR Clinical Informatics Ltd.<hildi@freshehr.com>

details.purpose: For the recording of the Edmonton Frail Scale individual domain items and overall score.
details.use: Use to record the Edmonton Frail Scale items and score.

items.items: A specific date and/or time which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Abilty to place numbers and hands in the correct position on a pre-drawn circle to indicate a clock.
The subject made one or more minor spacing errors.
Number of times admitted to hospital in last year.
The subject has not been admitted to hospital in the last year.
The subject has been admitted to hospital once or twice in the last year.
The subject has been admitted to hospital more than twice in the last year.
The subject describes their general health as excellent, very good or good.
The subject describes their general health as fair.
The subject describes their general health as poor.
The subject requires help with none or one activities.
The subject requires help with two to four activities.
The subject requires help with five to eight activities.
Able to count on someone willing and able to meet needs when help required.
The subject always has social support.
The subject sometimes has social support.
The subject never has social support.
Using five or more different prescription medications on a regular basis.
The subject does not use five or more different prescription medications on a regular basis.
The subject uses five or more different prescription medications on a regular basis.
Does the subject forget to take their prescription medications at times?
The subject does not forget to take their prescription medications.
The subject at times forgets to take their prescription medications.
Has the subject recently lost weight so that clothing has become looser?
The subject has not lost weight recently.
The subject has lost weight recently.
Does the subject often feel sad or depressed?
The subject does not feel sad or depressed.
The subject often feels sad or depressed.
Does the subject have a problem with losing control of urine unvoluntarily?
The subject does not have a problem with losing control of urine involuntarily.
The subject has a problems with losing control of urine involuntary.
Length of time taken to get up from chair, walk to mark about 3 metres away at a safe and comforable pace and return to chair.
The subject takes 0 to 10 seconds to perform the task.
The subject takes 11 to 20 seconds to perform the task.
More than 20 seconds or unwilling or requiring assistance
The subject takes more than 20 seconds to perform the task or is unwilling or requires help.
Record any issues or factors that may impact on the observation or the score.
Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
e.g. Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with HL7 or CDISC equivalents.
